CONJUGATES: shepherds (pl. n. / 3rd sing. v.) | shepherded (pt. pp.) | shepherding (prp.)
ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English schepherde, from Old English scēaphierde, a compound of scēap ('sheep') and hierde ('herder').

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person whose job is to take care of sheep and guard the flock.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The shepherd used his dog to round up the stray lambs.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 牧羊人利用他的狗来聚集走失的羔羊。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A spiritual guide or protector, often referring to a Christian minister (pastor) or to God/Christ.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （比喻义）精神导师；保护者；（尤指基督教的）牧师或上帝/基督。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The 23rd Psalm begins, 'The Lord is my Shepherd.'
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 《诗篇》第23篇的开头是：“耶和华是我的牧者。”

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To guide or lead a group of people or animals carefully, often in a protective manner.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 引导；带领；护送（一群人或动物）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He successfully shepherded the journalists through the crowded halls of the conference center.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他成功地引导记者们穿过了拥挤的会议中心大厅。

REGISTER: General, often used figuratively or professionally.
